description: This course examines how basic conventions, styles, and forms of music convey drama, emotion,
and meaning in dance, opera, musicals, and film genres. Intended for the general student
(non-music major), this course provides fundamental musical listening skills and vocabulary to
analyze and describe how music can partner with movement, texts, and visual images to portray
time, place, and plot, while simultaneously depicting a character's mental state, conveying
political messages or predicting the future.  Offered Interim only.
